articles.headline: Yellen Expects Fed to Raise Rates This Year
articles.snippet: Ms. Yellen’s remarks are the latest indication that officials think the economy has shaken off a slow start to 2015 and will grow in spite of trouble abroad.
articles.abstract: Ms. Yellen’s remarks are the latest indication that officials think the economy has shaken off a slow start to 2015 and will grow in spite of trouble abroad.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, said on Friday that she expected the Fed to raise its benchmark interest rate this year as the domestic economy continued to gain strength.

articles.headline: Dish Suit Shows Close Ties Between Executive and Board Members
articles.snippet: The shareholders’ lawsuit contends that a board that included members with personal and family connections to the company’s chief did not act in their best interests.
articles.abstract: The shareholders’ lawsuit contends that a board that included members with personal and family connections to the company’s chief did not act in their best interests.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cozy corporate boards, populated by a chief executive’s pals, are an all-too-common hazard of investing in a publicly owned company. But rarely do stockholders get an inside look at the ties between board members and the chief executives they are supposed to supervise.

articles.headline: Background Check Flaw Let Dylann Roof Buy Gun, F.B.I. Says
articles.snippet: A loophole in the law and an F.B.I. error led to the sale of the gun used to kill nine people at a Charleston, S.C., church, the bureau said.
articles.abstract: A loophole in the law and an F.B.I. error led to the sale of the gun used to kill nine people at a Charleston, S.C., church, the bureau said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The man accused of killing nine people in a historically black church in South Carolina last month was able to buy the gun used in the attack because of a breakdown in the federal gun background check system, the F.B.I. said Friday.

articles.headline: Greece’s Parliament Approves Prime Minister’s Bailout Plan
articles.snippet: The measure, which passed by an overwhelming margin one day before Sunday’s deadline, is remarkably similar to the one Greek voters rejected less than a week ago.
articles.abstract: The measure, which passed by an overwhelming margin one day before Sunday’s deadline, is remarkably similar to the one Greek voters rejected less than a week ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS — Setting the stage for a pivotal deal with Europe, the Greek Parliament early Saturday approved Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras’s proposal for a three-year, $59 billion rescue package with harsh austerity terms that was remarkably similar to the one Greek voters rejected in a referendum less than a week ago.
articles.byline: By Liz Alderman and Andrew Higgins

articles.headline: A Bold Proposal to Offer Greece Some Financial Relief
articles.snippet: The provocative idea, to make private-sector bond investors — not governments — the primary creditors, would help overcome what many economists see as the central obstacle to a deal.
articles.abstract: The provocative idea, to make private-sector bond investors — not governments — the primary creditors, would help overcome what many economists see as the central obstacle to a deal.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUNICH — With time running short for Greece to meet a deadline to stay in the eurozone, a small but influential circle of debt experts are putting forward a provocative plan to persuade foreign investors to lend Greece the money it needs to survive.

articles.headline: Outside Psychologists Shielded U.S. Torture Program, Report Finds
articles.snippet: The scathing report, commissioned by the American Psychological Association, says the C.I.A. used prominent outside psychologists to quell internal objections.
articles.abstract: The scathing report, commissioned by the American Psychological Association, says the C.I.A. used prominent outside psychologists to quell internal objections.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Central Intelligence Agency’s health professionals repeatedly criticized the agency’s post-Sept. 11 interrogation program, but their protests were rebuffed by prominent outside psychologists who lent credibility to the program, according to a new report.

articles.headline: It’s Silicon Valley 2, Ellen Pao 0: Fighter of Sexism Is Out at Reddit
articles.snippet: Ms. Pao, the interim chief executive, will remain as an adviser to the board. She had been under intense scrutiny from members of the company’s devoted web community.
articles.abstract: Ms. Pao, the interim chief executive, will remain as an adviser to the board. She had been under intense scrutiny from members of the company’s devoted web community.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ellen Pao became a hero to many when she took on the entrenched male-dominated culture of Silicon Valley. But sentiment is a fickle thing. Late Friday she fell victim to a crowd demanding her ouster as chief executive of the popular social media site Reddit.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and David Streitfeld

articles.headline: Signs of a Growing Hush in China’s Economy
articles.snippet: Small signs of malaise are emerging after the stock market slump, from the deferral of major purchases to desperate attempts to restart cash flow.
articles.abstract: Small signs of malaise are emerging after the stock market slump, from the deferral of major purchases to desperate attempts to restart cash flow.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — As China’s stock market tumbled over the last month, some wealthy apartment owners began trying to sell. Shopping malls became quieter. And customers at automobile dealerships across the country asked to defer delivery and payment for previously ordered cars.

articles.headline: How CVS Quit Smoking and Grew Into a Health Care Giant
articles.snippet: The pharmacy retailer that stopped selling cigarettes last year is also expanding its in-store clinics, a business well suited to the quickly evolving health care landscape.
articles.abstract: The pharmacy retailer that stopped selling cigarettes last year is also expanding its in-store clinics, a business well suited to the quickly evolving health care landscape.
articles.lead_paragraph: Michael Gaffney’s throat was scratchy for days, and lemon tea was not helping. So he dropped into a MinuteClinic above a CVS store in Midtown Manhattan on a lunch break. Within minutes, a nurse practitioner tested him for strep throat (negative), suggested lozenges and a regimen (ample fluids, no spicy food), collected a co-payment ($25 cash) and sent him on his way.

articles.headline: Meeting on Greece Debt Breaks Up With No Deal
articles.snippet: European finance ministers could not agree on whether Greece should be granted its third bailout since 2010, leaving the Continent hours from what could be a historic rupture.
articles.abstract: European finance ministers could not agree on whether Greece should be granted its third bailout since 2010, leaving the Continent hours from what could be a historic rupture.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — A meeting of European finance ministers broke up late Saturday with no agreement on whether Greece should be granted its third bailout since 2010, reflecting deep divides over whether the Athens government can be trusted to repay huge new loans and leaving the Continent hours from what could be a historic rupture.

articles.headline: The Best Way to Vilify Hillary Clinton? G.O.P. Spends Heavily to Test It
articles.snippet: Republicans are using focus groups in an expensive and sophisticated effort to refine the most potent lines of attack against Mrs. Clinton in campaign ads against her.
articles.abstract: Republicans are using focus groups in an expensive and sophisticated effort to refine the most potent lines of attack against Mrs. Clinton in campaign ads against her.
articles.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla. — Inside an office park here, about a dozen women gathered to watch a 30-second television spot that opened with Hillary Rodham Clinton looking well-coiffed and aristocratic, toasting champagne with her tuxedoed husband, the former president, against a golden-hued backdrop.
articles.byline: By Ashley Parker and Amy Chozick

articles.headline: While Some Are Shocked by ‘Go Set a Watchman,’ Others Find Nuance in a Bigoted Atticus Finch
articles.snippet: The lawyer who fought racial inequality in Harper Lee’s “To Kill a Mockingbird” is an aging racist in her new novel “Go Set a Watchman,” a more complex character in which some see added value.
articles.abstract: The lawyer who fought racial inequality in Harper Lee’s “To Kill a Mockingbird” is an aging racist in her new novel “Go Set a Watchman,” a more complex character in which some see added value.
articles.lead_paragraph: With all the debate brewing over the origins of Harper Lee’s novel “Go Set a Watchman,” the biggest bombshell turned out to be an explosive plot twist that no one saw coming.

articles.headline: China Fences In Its Nomads, and an Ancient Life Withers
articles.snippet: The Chinese government is in the final stages of a 15-year-old effort to transform millions of pastoralists who once roamed China’s vast borderlands.
articles.abstract: The Chinese government is in the final stages of a 15-year-old effort to transform millions of pastoralists who once roamed China’s vast borderlands.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADOI, China — If modern material comforts are the measure of success, then Gere, a 59-year-old former yak-and-sheep herder in China’s western Qinghai Province, should be a happy man.

articles.headline: The New Reddit C.E.O.’s Many Challenges
articles.snippet: Steve Huffman, the new chief executive of Reddit, faces numerous challenges at the online message board. That includes not repeating the stumbles of previous leaders like Ellen Pao, who stepped down from Reddit on Friday.
articles.abstract: Steve Huffman, the new chief executive of Reddit, faces numerous challenges at the online message board. That includes not repeating the stumbles of previous leaders like Ellen Pao, who stepped down from Reddit on Friday.
articles.lead_paragraph: Steve Huffman has just walked into what may be one of the most difficult jobs in Silicon Valley.

articles.headline: Modern Doctors’ House Calls: Skype Chat and Fast Diagnosis
articles.snippet: The same forces that have made instant messaging and video calls part of daily life for many Americans are now shaking up basic medical care.
articles.abstract: The same forces that have made instant messaging and video calls part of daily life for many Americans are now shaking up basic medical care.
articles.lead_paragraph: TACOMA, Wash. — One night, when her face turned puffy and painful from what she thought was a sinus infection, Jessica DeVisser briefly considered going to an urgent care clinic, but then decided to try something “kind of sci-fi.”

articles.headline: Voting Rights Legacy of the ’60s Heads to Court as North Carolina Law Is Tested
articles.snippet: A federal trial is meant to determine whether recent changes in the state’s election laws discriminate against black voters. It could help define the scope of voting rights across the country in the coming presidential election.
articles.abstract: A federal trial is meant to determine whether recent changes in the state’s election laws discriminate against black voters. It could help define the scope of voting rights across the country in the coming presidential election.
articles.lead_paragraph: Days after South Carolina confronted its past and lowered the Confederate battle flag, North Carolina will grapple with its present-day rules that determine access to the voting booth.

articles.headline: With Ban on Exports Lifted, Japan Arms Makers Cautiously Market Wares Abroad
articles.snippet: Less than 1 percent of Japan’s industrial output is military-related, but some of the nation’s large industrial conglomerates have long had sidelines in military production.
articles.abstract: Less than 1 percent of Japan’s industrial output is military-related, but some of the nation’s large industrial conglomerates have long had sidelines in military production.
articles.lead_paragraph: YOKOHAMA, Japan — Some of Japan’s biggest companies, best known for motorcycles, washing machines and laptop computers, are pitching a new line of global products: military hardware.

articles.headline: Scott Walker, Viewed as ‘Authentic,’ Aims for ‘Smart’ in the 2016 Race
articles.snippet: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is emerging from a crash course in foreign and domestic issues with the aim of reassuring Republican activists and donors.
articles.abstract: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is emerging from a crash course in foreign and domestic issues with the aim of reassuring Republican activists and donors.
articles.lead_paragraph: After listening to Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin as he has traveled the country preparing his campaign for president, which officially begins on Monday, admiring voters most often describe him as “authentic,” “real” and “approachable,” Mr. Walker’s advisers say.

articles.headline: Leaders From Eurozone Work Into Morning on Greek Crisis
articles.snippet: The mood was tense, with some Greek officials pushing back against some proposals and rifts emerging among the 19 nations using the euro over how far to go in making new demands.
articles.abstract: The mood was tense, with some Greek officials pushing back against some proposals and rifts emerging among the 19 nations using the euro over how far to go in making new demands.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Haggling through the night into Monday morning over a deal to calm Greece’s debt crisis, European leaders demanded that Athens make new concessions and quickly adopt a host of economic policy changes as they worked to overcome deep divisions and avert a historic fracture in the Continent’s common currency.
articles.byline: By Andrew Higgins and James Kanter

articles.headline: Mexican Drug Kingpin, El Chapo, Escapes Prison Through Tunnel
articles.snippet: The prison break of Joaquín Guzmán Loera humiliated the Mexican government, which had touted his capture as a crucial achievement in the drug war.
articles.abstract: The prison break of Joaquín Guzmán Loera humiliated the Mexican government, which had touted his capture as a crucial achievement in the drug war.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shortly before 9 p.m. on Saturday, Joaquín Guzmán Loera, the Mexican drug kingpin whose capture last year had been trumpeted by his country’s government as a crucial victory in its bloody campaign against the narcotics trade, stepped into the shower in his cell in the most secure wing of the most secure prison in Mexico.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Randal C. Archibold

articles.headline: Growth in the ‘Gig Economy’ Fuels Work Force Anxieties
articles.snippet: The shift to an economy where millions of Americans work as contractors or temporary employees is increasing voters’ economic anxieties ahead of next year’s election.
articles.abstract: The shift to an economy where millions of Americans work as contractors or temporary employees is increasing voters’ economic anxieties ahead of next year’s election.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the California Labor Commissioner’s Office ruled last month that an Uber driver was an employee deserving of a variety of workplace protections — and was not, as the company maintained, an independent contractor — it highlighted the divided feelings many Americans have about what is increasingly being called the “gig economy.”

articles.headline: Asian Tech Start-Ups Quietly Earn Backing
articles.snippet: So far this year, Asia has created 11 tech companies with valuations of $1 billion or more, compared with 19 in North America.
articles.abstract: So far this year, Asia has created 11 tech companies with valuations of $1 billion or more, compared with 19 in North America.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The rise of a mobile software company from nothing to a $1 billion valuation in just over a year from its first product release would typically draw rapt attention, and jealousy, inside Silicon Valley.

articles.headline: China’s Incendiary Market Is Fanned by Borrowers and Manipulation
articles.snippet: After a bull run reminiscent of the Internet bubble of 1998-2000 in the United States, regulators in China have tried to prop up the markets.
articles.abstract: After a bull run reminiscent of the Internet bubble of 1998-2000 in the United States, regulators in China have tried to prop up the markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — At the height of the frenzy for Chinese stocks, just about every company was a winner.

articles.headline: Grieving Joe Biden Focuses on the Job He Has Now, Not the Next One
articles.snippet: Though Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has thrown himself back into work after the death of Beau Biden, his staff does not plan further than two weeks ahead so he can care for his family.
articles.abstract: Though Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has thrown himself back into work after the death of Beau Biden, his staff does not plan further than two weeks ahead so he can care for his family.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Hosting a rockfish and crab lunch for a visiting Vietnamese leader, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. seemed subdued as he talked of a painful history and a promising future between the United States and Vietnam. He ad-libbed some remarks, made a few mild jokes and stared straight ahead when his guest spoke.

articles.headline: Comcast Offers Its Alternative to Cable TV, Using the Web
articles.snippet: The $15-a-month service, which will provide access to live and on-demand programming, reflects a mainstream cable company’s effort to stay relevant as streaming grows in popularity.
articles.abstract: The $15-a-month service, which will provide access to live and on-demand programming, reflects a mainstream cable company’s effort to stay relevant as streaming grows in popularity.
articles.lead_paragraph: Comcast, the country’s largest cable operator, is responding to the rush of new streaming television alternatives with the start of its own web-based offering that includes a bundle of broadcast networks and the premium cable network HBO.

articles.headline: Premier of Greece, Alexis Tsipras, Accepts Creditors’ Austerity Deal
articles.snippet: The agreement announced early Monday allows only the start of detailed negotiations on a new assistance package for Greece.
articles.abstract: The agreement announced early Monday allows only the start of detailed negotiations on a new assistance package for Greece.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS — Forced by his nation’s creditors into broad new concessions to avert financial collapse, Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece returned home on Monday with just days to sell the deal to fractured lawmakers and a dazed electorate.
articles.byline: By Suzanne Daley and Liz Alderman

articles.headline: Scott Walker Enters 2016 Presidential Race, Pledging Conservative Agenda
articles.snippet: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, who looked strong earlier this year, joins the 2016 presidential race at a time of growing challenges for him, especially in Iowa.
articles.abstract: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, who looked strong earlier this year, joins the 2016 presidential race at a time of growing challenges for him, especially in Iowa.
articles.lead_paragraph: WAUKESHA, Wis. — Gov. Scott Walker, who built a national conservative following by crippling public employee unions and then defeating an effort to recall him, announced on Monday that he was running for president as a Washington outsider who would reduce taxes, challenge Iran and Russia, and cut the size of the federal government.

articles.headline: Deal on Greek Debt Crisis Exposes Europe’s Deepening Fissures
articles.snippet: In the name of preserving European solidarity, the ultimatum put to Athens over the weekend required something close to the surrender of the nation’s sovereignty.
articles.abstract: In the name of preserving European solidarity, the ultimatum put to Athens over the weekend required something close to the surrender of the nation’s sovereignty.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany said about Greece on Sunday that “the most important currency has been lost: that is trust and reliability.” But many Germans think the most important currency that has been lost is the deutsche mark, the symbol of rectitude and confidence that embodied West Germany’s ascent from the ashes of World War II.

articles.headline: Mexico Prison Break by ‘El Chapo’ Is a Blow to President Peña Nieto
articles.snippet: The breakout of the drug lord Joaquín Guzmán Loera shattered President Enrique Peña Nieto’s pledge to break with the corruption and incompetence of the past, and led Mexicans to question his government’s effectiveness.
articles.abstract: The breakout of the drug lord Joaquín Guzmán Loera shattered President Enrique Peña Nieto’s pledge to break with the corruption and incompetence of the past, and led Mexicans to question his government’s effectiveness.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — However bruised and battered he has been, President Enrique Peña Nieto has always clung to the polished image he sold to the Mexican electorate: the perfectly coifed wunderkind who would break with the corrupt, incompetent past and get things done.
articles.byline: By William Neuman, Randal C. Archibold and Azam Ahmed
